alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 1:59PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside County through 230 PM PDT... At 159 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Cottonwood Visitor, or 13 miles northwest of Chiriaco Summit. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Visitor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West
